channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Famine is unfolding in Gaza, an alert from UN-backed food security experts confirms
item.description: Gaza faces a severe risk of famine, with food consumption and nutrition indicators at their worst levels since the conflict began, according to a Integrated Food Security Phase Classification Alert.

item.title: Uncertainty over access to certain childhood vaccines has pediatricians worried
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is changing how federal agencies handle vaccine recommendations. Pediatricians say some parents worry about future access and want to get kids' shots early.

item.title: The political firestorm over the Epstein files followed Trump to Scotland
item.description: Trump went to Scotland for a golf minibreak, but the political firestorm over the Epstein files followed him there.

item.title: Texas congressman takes questions on Epstein and Social Security during town hall
item.description: Texas Congressman Keith Self held one of the few GOP town halls planned while the House is on summer recess. Constituents asked about Social Security solvency as well as the Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: American Jews are reclaiming German citizenship amid political concerns
item.description: A growing number of American Jews whose parents and grandparents fled Germany during World War II are now getting German citizenship, in part because of political concerns in the United States.

item.title: A railroad mega-merger could create the country's first coast-to-coast freight railroad
item.description: Two of the U.S.'s largest railroad companies, Union Pacific and Norfolk Southern, say they plan to merge, which would create the country's first coast-to-coast freight railroad.

item.title: Chicago Cubs legend Ryne Sandberg has died at age 65
item.description: Chicago Cubs legend and Hall of Famer Ryne Sandberg has died after battling cancer. The second baseman was a Cub's fan favorite who earned a reputation as one of the best all-around players in the game.

item.title: What we know about NYC shooting suspect
item.description: New York City authorities are trying to learn additional information about 27-year-old Shane Tamura, the gunman who burst into a Manhattan skyscraper and killed four people, including an NYPD officer.

item.title: Remembering poet Thomas Sayers Ellis, dead at 61
item.description: An influential poet has died at the age of 61. Thomas Sayers Ellis was the founder of a community of Black poets, as well as a musician, photographer and bandleader.

item.title: These underwater sculptures help save the Italian sea from trawlers
item.description: Sculptures are sunk to the bottom of the Mediterranean sea with concrete blocks to break the nets of the trawlers that devastate marine life. They now protect miles of Tuscan coastline.
